It integrates with your media center or home theater PC to enable scrobbling, so everything is automatic. Some people like to check in from their phone, so Trakt enable\'s that too. \n\n If you would like to connect your Trakt account so you can manage your shows from the UpNext TV Series Manager app, click the connect button below. Trakt is well established platform that allows you to be able to track your shows, episode by episode, season by season. We want to make sure you have that capability when viewing any of the show information you come across in Upnext. You will first need to connect your Trakt account (a button will be displayed where a Trakt account link is required).

If you have a show you want to watch or are currently watching, you can simply add the show to your watchlist from the show detail screen\'s \"Add to Watchlist\" button (which will only appear if you have connected your Trakt account). When you mark all seasons or episodes of that show as watched, Trakt will automatically remove it from your watchlist.
Any shows that are marked as watched either through UpNext, some third-party software or directly on the Trakt.tv platform will be displayed here.
Why do I need a Trakt account?

The aim of the UpNext TV Series Manager is to not only provide you with series information but also functionality that will allow you to track and manage your favorite shows. 

This tracking functionality is offered by the very reputable Trakt service which we have integrated into the management sections of the UpNext TV Series Manager. To be able to take advantage of the Trakt features in the Upnext TV Series Manager such as managing your watchlist, collection or your series watch history, you will need to have a Trakt account and through any of the "Connect to Trakt" buttons in the UpNext TV Series Manager we can then link your Trakt account. 

At any time you can revoke UpNext TV Series Manager's access to your account from your Trakt.tv account. Bear in mind this will then sever any connection UpNext TV Series manager has to your account thus disabling any management features - watchlist, history and collection.

Trakt is a platform that does many things, but primarily keeps track of TV shows and movies you watch. It integrates with your media center or home theater PC to enable scrobbling, so everything is automatic. Some people like to check in from their phone, so we enable that too.

If you have a show that you are currently watching or intend to watch, then you can add it to your watchlist. This watchlist will be managed by the Trakt service. You can view items in your watchlist on the UpNext TV Series Manager by going to the \"Watchlist\" tab. Here all items that are on your Trakt watchlist will be listed where you can also remove items which in turn will be removed on Trakt.

Your watchlist is built in list to keep track of everything you want to watch. Once you watch an item from your watchlist, it automatically gets removed. Watching 1 episode of a show or season will remove that item as well. Your calendars and progress are automatically kept up to date with what you’re watching, no need to keep it on your watchlist. \n\nIf your watched progress for a series is 100% watched, that is, you have watched all the episodes that have aired since the series first premiered up until its most recent episode, then adding to watchlist will not be possible until new episodes become available. A watchlist is intended for shows you want to watch to 100%. In other words you want to watch all the episodes for the series that have aired to date.

Items in your collection will consist of episodes, seasons or even shows that you own digitally or physically and have available to watch.\n\nFrom the UpNext TV Series Manager the \"Add to Collection\" button is what you will need to click in order to add a show, its season or its episode.

Your collected TV shows will be added to your personal collection page on Trakt [https://trakt.tv/users/me/collection] and can be accessible on the UpNext TV Series Manager by clicking on the Collection tab
